title: The closest thing we have to a Poison Mage in the game is Singed.
body:
And he isn't even an actual Mage.

People might argue Cassiopeia is a Poison Mage, but she is nothing but a Twin Fang Machine Gun(she has always been), at least that's where most of her damage comes from anyway. Spamming Es on Poisoned enemies.

Can we re-rework her into doing the thing that she was supposed to in the first place? Spreading Large Heavy-hitting DoTs across the enemy team, kinda like Singed? 

And Teemo isn't a Poison Mage either. Teemo doesn't beat you with Poison DoTs, he beats you by annoying you and making you go on Tilt with Shroomspam.

No, Riot said AoE DoT damage isn't healthy because it used to do a ton more damage. Her 'rework' tuned her entire kit down. While she was always an E spammer, her old kit used to half life anyone hit by the full duration of her Q.. since it did 80% of her AP. lol. If they switch her single target DoT's with low CD's to switch between targets as her Q, her W left to be the same, and her E changed to give a slight boost in her poison damage or even just be a targeted poison while her Q is a long-ish range skill shot poisonball of death, she'd be in a pretty damn good spot as a Poison Mage. They'd be able to adjust her kit accordingly since she'd be mostly single target with an actual skill shot that a tank could block, yet because of how her kit works, she'd still get a boost in speed and be able to kite that tank for days, which would make her into a kiting DoT mage, something we don't have. Currently, we had Malz who insta-gibs with R and Swain who facetanks. And Singed just trolls. Rumble is about the only DoT mage that fits the bill, but he's short ranged outside of his R, which is meant to give him proper team fight potential. Which is sorta funny since his main two damage abilities are AoE DoTs, though both of them are positional, not "You're taking damage because you got hit to begin with". You can flash away and be safe where as Cass has always been, "You're hit, now you're dead.", sorta like a Teemo Shroom, except that was her Q.

There is no difference between AoE DoT and AoE instant damage... the only difference (if they deal the same damage) is that in general the DoT is weaker (the target can kill you or do more before going down and dying to the DoT and have longer time to react with shields and heals and they can be removed with QSS)

The only situations in which DoT's are stronger is with things like Rylais (this is the reason DoT's have the weakest slow) or Liandries
or if they have in built effects like Swain E which have a damage increase or his Q which has a slow (though that is more like a tether since it can be broken to reduce/avoid the damage)
Logically, there is no difference at all between Instant and DoT, but in Riot's mind during Cass's rework, they decided AoE DoT had too much hidden power, which is silly, but eh.

That isn't true there is a difference between DoT and instant damage
DoT is weaker if the total damage is the same... (and there isn't any added effect to the DoT)
Why? Well because your target is more likely to survive because HP regen or life steal or it gives them more time to react with heals/shields
And if you theoretically drop enough damage on your target to eventually kill them with DoTs... your target can still kill you (since the DoT takes a while to finish killing of your target while instant damage just deletes your target which means they can't hit you back or kill you)

For these reasons DoT's usually have higher damage than instant damage abilities or they have additional effects

I think the problem with poison mages is that you have one of two things, they're either completely ineffective in lane with very little impact in shorther skirmishes or completely obliterate teamfights and are just overwhelmingly oppressive in lane.
And that's based on what exactly...?

Based on the fact that if you're to have any impact in a teamfight the damage needs to be high enough to actually do anything with, and not be reduced to laughable damage by an Aegis, which you're guaranteed to have on the other team.

So to put the damage high enough then makes a single ability max in lane basically lethal if you get hit by it as it'll chunk out a ton of your health.

You could partially work around this with putting a lot of the punch into the ability power scaling, but that only goes so far.
How is that any different than an AoE burst mage like Brand?

Depends on what you specifically want.

You want a "Poison Mage"

Poison - can either refer to just a DoT as a mechanic (which can be thematically different, but mechanically the same. For example a DoT Champion would be Brand or Malzahar, where a *poison* Champion is more limited), or you can refer to Poison as a *theme*, in which case Teemo and Cass *are* viable responses. Even if they deal damage through other mechanics, their theme is still tied to poison. Teemo doesn't actually kill you by annoying you. He *does*, in fact, kill you via poison damage. EXCLUSIVELY. He passively deals poison damage on hit. His Q blinds you (which thematically is a "blinding dart" which I see as a form of poison/toxin) and his Shrooms poison you. Literally the ONLY way he can kill you is via some kind of poison-like effect.

Mage - Again, do you just mean "magic damage" or do you mean "spell casting, book-wielding magician"? This also causes problems. Thematically when we think of poison its usually organic (hence mushrooms and toxic clouds), not something arcane like Ryze's abilities.


So if you want, for example, a Champion that uses Poison [Theme] but does not have to be a Mage [Theme], then you could say that {{champion:29}} is a good "Poison-based Champion". He passively poisons his enemies and often gets kills by stacking it up and expunging them. Literally killing you via poison.

But if you specifically Poison "Mage" I don't think you'll get much closer to Teemo.

How is Singed not fun to play? You don't have to be super complex to be fun, just the playstyle that it facilitate. Singed plays the meta game, he gets inside the entire enemy team's head while dodging skillshot, flinging fools and knowing exactly when to go in and when to get out to create the juiciest of bait, map knowledge to proxy and draw pressure

Singed's entire kit involves him running around, there's no depth to it and half of his kit is stat modifiers. The rest being extremely simple. Due to this It's impossible to fully balance Singed out. If he ever gets buffed to where he's much stronger, he'll be insanely overpowered because of how his kit doesn't have much room for counterplaying because of how extremely simple it is. I'm not saying Singed isn't viable, and that he's a bad champion, though I think people would clearly want more to do with him than just running around in circles to take off pressure from the map. Quite frankly, the champion can be extremely annoying and make the game unfun since he just proxy farms while the enemy laner just sits there and farms too. Singed players also tend to stay top lane for most of the game, since Singed can't really team fight or do much other than draw pressure from the rest of the map. This isn't bad, but I feel like Riot could do a lot more with the champion aside from making his entire kit revolving around just running in circles.
